alert.note: Alert for Hall; Howard (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued July 16 at 8:24PM CDT until July 16 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southwestern Howard County in central Nebraska... Northwestern Hall County in south central Nebraska... * Until 900 PM CDT. * At 824 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Farwell, or 20 miles northwest of Grand Island, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and hail up to two inches in diameter. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Dannebrog and Boelus around 830 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Cairo. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
